website_summaries.verdict: Buyers love this stand for its unique and contemporary design, though it also showcases a sturdy build with quality materials.
pros: Boasts a universal headphone fit that prevents headphones from being bent or creased
Bottom sponge pads provide stability for the piece
Option to purchase in a transparent construction
cons: Many buyers complained the price was too expensive for the quality, though they still appreciated the product's functionality

website_summaries.verdict: The minimalist design and low cost make the AmoVee the perfect addition to any desk.
pros: The AmoVee feels durable, despite the low cost
The slim design doesn't take up much space, and pairs well with any desk layout
Adhesive rubber padding attached to the legs prevents sliding
The stand advertises as universal and can hold up any headset with ease
cons: It takes 2 hands to properly remove the headset from the stand

customer_reviews.title: This headphone stand is the best headphone stand ever
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand is the best headphone stand ever, she is beautiful too. She makes nights at the computer a little less lonely. Thanks you, headphone stand.
customer_reviews.author: cassey

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: its a cheap piece of overpriced pvc shaped like a head for your headphones... it works, but you can't just take your headphones off you have to hold the plastic and pull them off because if you don't it will fall over making the loudest noise you have ever heard cause your baby to scream and scream so you can't play your video games.... besides that instance that happened a few days ago, they work to keep my desk clean.... I do feel it is way way way over priced ... but it accomplished the task, I will be making a base that is heavy so I can lift the headphones off without the possibility of waking the whole block
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Looking Piece Of Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Looks sharp & fits my Sony XM3’s perfect. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much!!! I knew I needed something to place my headphones on when I had them laying around everywhere and it was starting to look very cluttered. This product was just what I needed. It is very shiny and it is made with a hard acrylic so it is very sturdy even if you place heavy headphones on it. It looks great with any setup because of how nice it is built. The shape is perfect for headphones, the headphones squeeze tightly around the stand and it keeps them from getting ruined or scuffed up.
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I love the uniqueness of the AmoVee headphone stand. It lends style to my gaming desk set up while holding the headphones securely in place when I am not gaming. My gaming set up needed a facelift and this headphone stand was a nice compliment.
customer_reviews.author: Dasoulink

customer_reviews.title: Im very happy with my purchase of the clear acrylic stand for ...
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with my purchase of the clear acrylic stand for my gaming headset! It doesn't fall back and stays put and holds my headset just perfectly. The acrylic feels sturdy and doesn't feel very cheap at all! I went with the clear one because I read past reviews saying the clear one was thicker (better material) and a but shorter (which I wanted) than the black one plus it complimented my white headset! (: Worth the $12!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: I was tired on hanging my headphones over one microphone arm stand or just over my desk taking more space. Finally I found this product and based on reviews decided to try it. I purchased the wider version and it's a nice solution. I haven't used the peel/sticker on the bottom as I'll be making some changes to my little studio. But I like that it's steady given it's weight so no concern that will fall down. I do recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely hated this thing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely hated this thing. Headphones stuck to the stand so if you wanted to remove them, the whole assembly came with them. Kind of defeats the purpose of the stand if I have to pick up the whole assembly over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Kaulfurst

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough, but wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: It's very simple. You know exactly what you're getting. A curved piece of plastic to hold headphones (which it does). However, in my experience with the Corsair Void Wireless headset, it's awkward to take them off. They slip on easily enough, but removing them from the stand can tip it off balance, or perhaps your headphones are too tight, and you need two hands to do it. My advice is to just buy a stand that has a front facing piece of plastic or pole to rest them on with a sturdy base.
customer_reviews.author: Dreygyr

customer_reviews.title: Great headset stand!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect fit for my corsair void pro headset. The material has a beautiful black glossy finish on it that contrasts really well with the other items on my desk. I feel like I really needed this and I would recommend this to anyone that needs a headset stand because you can't go wrong with this purchase. This headset stand also comes at a cheap, affordable price. This price tag will not make a dent in your wallet and will make a great addition to your desk. With the ergonomic shape of the headset stand it really brings everything together.
customer_reviews.author: Crock

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone Stand
customer_reviews.text: Very good headphone stand that does its intended purpose well. I'm giving it four stars because I had hoped it would be sturdier. You can easily knock over the stand if you don't carefully pull your headphones off. You have to use both hands to pull off your headphones or you will knock over the stand. I know this is a minor gripe and I know to some people it may seem petty but it's a matter of convenience, and in my opinion it is the main reason why you buy a headphone stand in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: lc0149

customer_reviews.title: Simple, aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.text: This product is so nice looking yet so simple. It holds my ATH M50x's without issue. If you're looking for an affordable and fancy looking headphone/headset holder than you should really consider this. The only issues I have is that the material picks up fingerprints and oils from the headset easily so you'll have to wipe it down often and while the included adhesive foam feet help keep it in place, I kind of wish it had more weight to it to help keep it more firmly planted on the desk, although it isn't much of an issue anyway as it would just be a nice added touch.
customer_reviews.author: Moses

customer_reviews.title: My Own Personal Preference and Opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a Headphone stand like this for a while now, and was disappointed after finally getting one. Again this is just my Opinion and Preference. I use a Steelseries Wireless Gaming Headset. It's a great looking Stand no doubt about that, my issues were mainly with the headphones I use. It held on too tightly so much so that whenever I wanted to use my headphones I'd lift the whole stand, My hair gets greasy and so does my headset and the grease from that transfers. If I were to choose, I'd buy the Headphone Hanger Instead. I'm rating it a 3/5 because Amazon Considers 3/5 as "it's okay" of a product which I feel it is.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Well Constructed and Fits the Bill!
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed item which perfectly fit my needs. Very sturdy and supports my Audio Technica ATH-M50X headphones very easily, without fear of tipping over. The material is attractive and the design very modern looking. Nice enough that I’ll buy at least one more to keep headphones on at my Sound Studio work station.
customer_reviews.author: Fierce Life Now!

customer_reviews.title: Poor design has made this stand prone to tipping over.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this stand for 2 years and decided to finally leave a review. While it is durable, it has a flawed design that makes it prone to tipping over. Headphone stands should have a sturdy base. This is extremely flimsy. A gentle touch will knock this over. Gently pulling the cable will tip it over. Please look else where for a headphone stand which has a sturdy/solid base.
customer_reviews.author: K-LAWN

customer_reviews.title: Sleek! Works much better than I thought it could!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received these today. I used to have a huge coffee/tea station and our electronics were edging it out quickly. I used these to allow for a sleeker and cleaner look. I’ve attached a photo(s.) these work great for my daughter’s and my headphones which are different brands and sizes. Easy to put them on and take them off, she’s 6 and he no issues.
customer_reviews.author: HK

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my setup. My headset sits so nicely, and I can take the headset off of the stand with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Wright

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: This is a great headphone stand for anyone who doesn't want anything crazy. I'm not a hardcore gamer so I got this one and it meshes really well with my TV stand that I have. The stand offers padding to prevent damage to whatever it stands on and I have not had an issue with it falling. Great affordable stand.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Not convenient
customer_reviews.text: Not convenient. I use my head phones for work so I put them on and take off probably 60-80 times a day. With this design, each time I remove my headphones, It takes a little time to get the headphones on. If I ordered a regular stand, I would quickly hook the headphones on the stand and be done. If you use your headphones occasionally, this will not be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Scubaa

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gaming Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons gaming headphones and it are great. Fits the headphones perfectly and is made pretty sturdy. The one piece design is great because there it no attachment point to break. We bought a different headphone stand and it broke off at the attachment point during assembly. We would definitely buy this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint & Dust Magnet
customer_reviews.text: Love this product just wish the bottom stickys would hold better and not slide off over time like I've shown in pictures. Also this this is a fingerprint and dust magne. Needs a spot to wrap your headphone cord and possibly a place to put the removable microphone from the headset. The red stuff in my picture is called sugra moldable glue. Works great for the 2 things this stand is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Too tippy
customer_reviews.text: My Bose headphones fit well on it, but the stand is too tippy. It needs to have a heavier base. If I accidentally bump the stand with the headphones on it, it tips over. The foam anti-slip pads they give you for the bottom fall off too easily and leave a very sticky residue on the bottom of the stand. I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, good for pets.
customer_reviews.text: I wish that there were a way to fix it In place. I like the material and the look but having it flop around my desk when I am using my headphones gets annoying. However I will say this “On the Desk” option is really good for pets as there is no dangling cords to tempt cats or dogs, and I have both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my ls50x headset, it is well made and looks great and would be a great addition to any desk or entertainment space to display you headphones/headset. Unfortunately I had to return mine as the ear cups are wider then the stand and I feared it would indent the cups over long periods.
customer_reviews.author: venom2879

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I ways very nervous buying this online especially considering the good price. It came when expected and is perfect. It fits the headset (which I believe is a little larger than most) and what I like is that it is sturdy and has a rounded top so it won’t damage or indent the headset. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Alyssalynn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what to expect...
customer_reviews.text: For $ 14 I wasn't really expecting a lot. I'm actually pretty surprised at how great the product is. It's sturdy, it fits my Arctis 7's and Sennheiser PXC 550's perfectly, the price is insanely reasonable and it looks damn good. Just wish I had bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Visually Appealing
customer_reviews.text: Nice and very aesthetically pleasing to look at. But the base will likely scratch wood surface or pretty much any surface you place it on. And you can’t just pick up your headset and go you’ve got to open your headset in a very awkward way or pick the entire stand up and remove your headset.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for plastic, but a good stand
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for about a month and a half to hold my A50s. The headphones I had previously I ruined by setting them on the ground when I wasn't using them. This caused enough wear and tear on the cable to eventually cause the cable to detach from the headset. These might be a little overpriced for a piece of curved plastic, but they do their job, and hold my headphones in a safe place. My headphones are on the heavier side and these hold them up without a problem. Fairly minimalistic and makes my headphones look cool even when not in use. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me? Doesn't come with any rubber or other grippy material on the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: Stands looks and feels great, but it boggled my mind to find out that it didn't have any support of grip on the bottom. So, expect it to slide around and scratch your expensive desk as you take your headphones on and off. I remedied this by putting some rubber feet on the bottom but for a $15 product you would expect something as simple as this would have taken into account.
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Solid build. Great for illuminating RGB lights around your desk
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how or why, but I thought these were translucent white and not clear. I was disappointed in myself when I unwrapped it, but quickly realize that it was a great idea to get the clear one. I have a bunch of cool RGB lighting for my desk, and this headphone stand illuminates with the changing color of the backlight. Pretty sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly stable!
customer_reviews.text: There is something that bothers me about leaving an expensive wireless gaming headset just lying around. I wanted to use a mannequin head but my wife said "Oh no you don't." She can be unreasonable at times. This stand provides a convenient place to put your headset / headphones when you're not using them. It is attractive and surprisingly stable. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rivers

customer_reviews.title: No Frills, Low-Cost, Functional and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of the clear acrylic AmoVee headphone stands for my Sennseiser 598 Cs and Grado SR80e headphones. Both fit just fine. The chord wraps neatly around the base of the stand. There's nothing fancy about these stands. They simply hold and display your headphones exactly like the picture. I feel that the price is exactly in line for what you get with this stand. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: They fall over really easily. I bought better ones for 8 dollars that aren't as impractical. I came back here to rewrite a review for this because it's such a pile of garbage. I'm throwing it in the trash I can't stand it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: looks good as well
customer_reviews.text: It works, looks good as well. Minor scratches on the finish, but you really need to look with a light shining on it to notice, so I don't think it's an issue. I ended up buying a mannequin head for my headphones shortly after because this is a little unstable. If you like the look get it, but find a spot where you can glue the base down for stability. Otherwise you might tip over your cans.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, Thick & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have several over ear bt headphones, & for my favorite 4 or 5 I keep em on these headphones “rests”. Some are the type you hang on the hook thingy, & a few I have are like this one, where you place on the piece almost like placing them on your head/on your ears. This one is arcrylic, it happens to be decently thick, but still really light, & it pretty much hides in plain sight. I’d buy more, & recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Kringle1Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Great stand! Cheap foam
customer_reviews.text: This stand looks very nice on the desk. It is solid and dose not feel cheap at all. The only problem I had with it was straight out of the box it has no kind of traction material on the bottom to keep it from sliding around. They include foam strips with an adhesive backing but after a week of use the foam had came loose and pretty much slid off on its own. Stands great, foams not
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet functional
customer_reviews.text: It's a headphone stand. I wouldn't have thought there would be much thought put into the design on such a seemingly simple product, but it is just that: well designed. I enjoy the way I can press together at the base to remove my headphones from the stand. It makes it very easy to put on and off. Another thing I like about them is that they do not fall over every time I put my headphones on them. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John T Darrah

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it's easy to knock over
customer_reviews.text: It might be that I am just clumsy, but I cannot count how many times I have accidentally knocked this stand over while trying to place or remove my headphones. I might have to get a different type of stand because I imagine any stand with this design is very easy to topple without a solid base.
customer_reviews.author: Duriel L Harris

customer_reviews.title: The stand is really not that bad, it cleans up my setup and keeps my ...
customer_reviews.text: The stand is really not that bad, it cleans up my setup and keeps my Astros off the desk from bothering me. But, this thing will not stay on its two feet to save its life, it weighs as much as a sheet of paper which makes it fall down EVERY time I get my headphones off of it. I ended up Super gluing the thing right on top of my PS4, so its safe to say its not going any where. So if I where to sell my PS4 it would come with a FREE headphone stand, not only does it keep your headphones neat and clean, it raises the value of your PS4. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's good but...
customer_reviews.text: It isn't heavy enough to where it's not going to fall over. Probably going to end up returning. I can't take my headphones off without it falling over or I have to hold it with one hand and pull it off with the other. Counter intuitive. Tried really hard to love it, just not practical.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Husted

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This holds my Astro A40's very snug and also looks nice on my desk as well. I also tested all my other headsets to test the fit. It worked with my Hyper X Cloud II's, Astro A50's, AT M50's, and TB 420x. I do plan and purchasing a few more because the natural contour of how they hold the headsets are nice. Also it may look flimsy, but it holds each headset very well and does not move. The price is right to protect your headset investments and looks stylish and simple to boot.
customer_reviews.author: nightshade

customer_reviews.title: Functional but that's about it.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Achieves ultimate goal of giving you a place to put your headphones. -Not an eyesore. -Good for the price. Cons: -Not as sturdy as it looks. Really needs a way to mount it or a nice sturdy base underneath it to provide some stability. -Actual material isn't too objectionable, but when you feel it you can tell it is cheap. -Is literally just a bent piece of plastic. Not exactly groundbreaking innovation here guys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: Thrilled to have a placed for my headphones. I purchased the transparent as according to reviews it shows less dust which means more play and less cleaning. I was concerned that this might be too large but it fits the headphones nicely and was smaller than expected which for my area I am working with is a good thing. Stand is made of a durable material. It does show some finger prints but a quick wipe and your good to go. If you are one that likes to have a place for everything or just want to better care for your headphones this stand provides a way to do both inexpensively.
customer_reviews.author: Dana S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! One tiny problem..
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this stand. It does what it needs to do but I feel it could do better. It is very light, so removing headphones from it can sometimes knock it over or pull the whole thing with it. Maybe a future model with a flat base so you can apply adhesive to keep the base in one spot? Either way it's a fantastic product and I thank Ed from Tech Source for the recommendation. He talks this stand up all the time! Sponsor him or something!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sleek,!elegant & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the clear stand and it is a perfect fit for the Beats Studio 2 headphones. This stand may be just a teensy tiny bit small for the largest Beats professional style headphones but I'm sure it will still work - though may not be as sturdy & steadfast with the heaviest of headphones. But for the weight, shape and style of the Studio or Solo model Beats, this stand is perfect. Doesn't fall over, isn't easily breakable and the thickness and height are perfectly suited for Dre Beats. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa427Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Bought for brother for gift; he loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My brother has expensive headphones and always had to set them down or lay them somewhere. He loves this and it fits perfectly even on a crowded desk.
customer_reviews.author: Quist

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headset Display Stand...Doesn't Topple
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was a bit skeptical and was sure the stand would topple with the weight, but nope. It holds my headset nicely. It's simple and easy. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Shoppergal70

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Can get knocked over easily. It’s not weighted at the base so it’s top heavy. Don’t use unless you are using cheap light headphones not gaming headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves the Headphone
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend has a bad habit of placing his expensive headphones on the side of his desk where they get bumped and break. So, I bought him this stand for Christmas two years ago and it is still going strong. Saves his headphones from being knocked around.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Doran

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great little stand for the money. The only thing I can say is that because of how light the item is, it's geared more towards a set of headphones that won't be constantly used. If you want a stand that you plan on putting headphones on and pulling them off then I would suggest a more robust stand. It can still work for that purpose but you're going to have to hold the stand down when removing the headphones or run the risk of scratching your desk with the sharp edges of the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone stand.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed, something to hold my headphones that doesn't look too flashy. Very sturdy acrylic material and it has a nice modern looking design. I saw a few with lights and some bold colors but this keeps it simple.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Best stand for headphones with replaced pads
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the pads on my Beats Wireless, but one of the pads did not stick very well. The pad would fall off on other stands I used that just supported the center of the headphones. This stand actually holds the pad in place and helps the adhesive to stick. Good find.
customer_reviews.author: Caballo

customer_reviews.title: Durable. Light Weight. Low price. Couldn't ask for better.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously as basic and perfect as i could have hoped. Its cheap but feels like good quality and definatly could take a fall without breaking. The only thing is that they have their logo in white on the bottom side which is very notiable and kinda steals from the headohones that amy be on display. I fixed this by simply adding electrical tape to it allowing it to look like a shinny flush black.
customer_reviews.author: Dawson Routier

customer_reviews.title: I like the way it looks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the black headphone stand to rest wireless headphones on at my desk at work. This stand is made of one molded piece of acrylic. It has a sleek, attractive design and functions well to hold my headphones. I like the way it looks, and I feel like it is a safer way to house my headphones to make sure they are secure and do not get buried under everything else on my desk. I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Buyers remorse. To much $$
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't worth the money. Maybe 4 or 5 dollars at best. It is a piece of thin plastic like plexiglass just bent into a shape. It is light and thin and easy to knock over when putting your headphones away. A weighted base of some kind would be nice for the price. I feel like I shoulda just kept my home made stand from trash around the house. It worked just as well. If the price comes down significantly I'd get one.
customer_reviews.author: MagneticNinja

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headset stand!
customer_reviews.text: There's plenty of other options on the market but I opted for these for the sole reason that they actually block off the earpads as you place your headphones/headset on them. I love this so much more than hanger style headphone/headset stands that are the commonplace on the market. Currently working perfectly for my Sennheiser Game ZERO headset!
customer_reviews.author: RyanEsau

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, attracts dust badly! Still a great bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphone stand, attracts dust like none other. I dust it with a micro fiber cloth daily to every other day. Besides the dust it’s great for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: It is a very sleek and minimalistic way to keep my headphones in one place. I was so tired of having to lay them on my PC or on the counter but this is sturdy enough for me to just place them there and be done.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Nice item for your headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived fast and packaged very well! They are a Christmas present but checked it out to see how well the headphones sit on them! They look nice and will look so great on his computer gaming desk! He will love them! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sadie1476

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I wish it formed better on my headphones so the ear pads were completely covered when resting on but these do not. I don't want bugs crawling into headphones LOL LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Gfnjr

customer_reviews.title: Great place to store headset!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is so happy to have somewhere to keep his gaming headset. The design is simple, yet sleek. The head shape makes it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good headset stand
customer_reviews.text: Good headset stand. My headset forms well and snug around it, cleans up my desk space a little by not just tossing my headset on my desk, but I put it on the stand now and it looks pretty good and sleek. Only complaint is that it's pretty flimsy. Maybe I need to hold it down it something, or glue it to the desk. Every time I go to stick my headset on it falls over, feels wobbly, shakes back and forth etc. Other than that it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I like it and worth the money. looks nice and is well made. only thing i dislike is that its easy to knock over, will prolly buy one with a heavy base at some point. But the design looks better than most designs with a base that Ive seen. It falling over some is not that big a deal, but worth noting for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jered Willman

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, just small.
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap and I would assume functional. They fit the Skullcandy Aviators well and they also fit the V-Moda M100s well. Unfortunately, I ordered these to fit my AKG reference headphones and they were way too small to fit them even with the headphone cable detached. I was unable to fit the Q701s, K545s, or N90Qs which was unfortunate. Other than being exactly what they stated, I'm a little disappointed they weren't a little broader.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: The Review
customer_reviews.text: Does what it was intended for, I don’t have to throw my headphone in a box or lay them everywhere, clean, elegant, and another addition to my PlayStation.
customer_reviews.author: The Review

customer_reviews.title: Great but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this looks on my desk. If you're looking for something sleek and cool looking this is it. It holds my steelseries 800 wireless headphones perfectly. My only complaint is that it is a bit flimsy and light. It moves around when you remove the headphones or place them on unless you open up the headphones wide. If hasn't fallen or anything but I do wish it was a bit more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: This is a great stand. I previously purchased a different stand from ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stand. I previously purchased a different stand from herebut it kept making an indentation on my headphones band. I really like this stand and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mari G.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Works just as intended. I am using it to display a gaming headset on a shelf. It is sturdy and simple, which doesnt take away from the beautiful headset.
customer_reviews.author: SandraR

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is amazing for the price. I currently have two and use them to hold my Wireless Razer Thresher and PS Gold Headsets. My only problem is it's not always the easiest to get the headphones back on the stand based on the design. Minor issue and it's not necessarily difficult, it's just not as easy since you have to fit them perfectly around the shape so they don't risk falling off.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: None Sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: I Received this item, opened it & file returning right away (lesser than 30'). it looks good but no sturdy. A stand without a sturdy structure is equal useless
customer_reviews.author: Kohn K.

customer_reviews.title: Falls over easily and the edges are sharp would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The stand is very unstable it will fall over extremely easily which is very disappointing because that is one of the main things you look for in a headphone stand and also the edges are quite sharp so if you have a nicer pair of headphones witg leather or fabric padding you have to be very careful or this stand will scrape and possibly cut your headphones. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: chris clayburn

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but...
customer_reviews.text: Looks good not a universal fit for my Def Tech symphony one headphones but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Great addition for my desk keeping my headphones from getting damaged. Like it's so much I'm going to get another one. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but could use a weighted base.
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand looks great and holds my cans well. That being said. I wish it had a weighted bottom or a wider bottom at least. With my AT headphones on it it tends to be top heavy and will fall over. My solution was to place it against a wall. It's very sleek though and looks great on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Gordonius

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this headphone stand to be so nice and sturdy. I had to tape it down because it kept falling over when I reach for my headphones but I'm a happy customer! c:
customer_reviews.author: PandaLovin

customer_reviews.title: Simple and wont break your budget .
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and planning on getting more for the house. I've mounted my m50s and sennheiser 598 they both fit nicely. The stand is a little wobbly but unless you're constantly shaking things these wont fall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, packaging is a little strange but it didn't break or scratch so i'm happy. Compliments my VMODA Crossfades nicely. Depending on the weight of the headphones this stand might have a tendency to tip over. I don't have a good solution, but I consider it acceptable considering it sits on my desk most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for holding my RIG 800 PS4 Headphones instead of just having them lie around taking up desk space. The clear acrylic is great to add the PS$ stickers or any other stickers to make it your own. My ambient strip lighting under the glass desk shines through the top and gives the headphone Display a nice glow.
customer_reviews.author: Ayana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good with my astros! Holds well and good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Sits on my desk pretty well and is sturdy while sitting up
customer_reviews.text: Sits on my desk pretty well and is sturdy while sitting up. I have a pair of open ear headphones with no headband across the top, just independent supports so the headphones are a little finicky to put onto the stand as they tend to slip and fall down. My other pair of closed headphones with a headband fit easily and perfectly though. Both pair require me to pick up the stand and slide them off though as the stand isn't quite weighted down enough to support just pulling the headphones off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Corela

customer_reviews.title: Good Product and Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Did some searching, and this is the best bang for your buck. There are reviews of people saying it isn't sturdy, but I always put my mic facing up (Astro A10), and it always stays straight and still. The plastic material is nice, and doesn't really scratch or wear too easily. The black is clean and smooth for your headset to stay put without wear-down. A good product, and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Fabrizzio

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 1st review was met for the headset itself not the acrylic head stand.
customer_reviews.author: lala meador

customer_reviews.title: Very useful headphone stand!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend and may just get one myself, he loves his headphone stand! Looks great on his desk and works as a nice stand, I got the clear/translucent kind which is short and wide making it sturdy yet still light weight. No more dropping headphones off the arm rest even though he still does that...lol I highly reccommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nakiya

customer_reviews.title: I love this stand
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand. The color is suave and clean on my desk. I use it to house my beats studios and it does it's job perfectly. The ability for me to keep the headphones in the open position while on standby prevents me from having to close the headphone repeatedly after each use (therefore decreasing wear and tear). A great buy and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Blackdynamite40

customer_reviews.title: Great, Stylish Headphone Stand
customer_reviews.text: Great, stylish headphone stand. If you're like me and don't read the specs before purchasing and just base it off the image, you'll be happy. The stand is built sturdy and thicker than I expected. Glad I bought it. Currently use it to hold my Corsair VOID Wireless Dolby 7.1 RGB Gaming Headset.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome P. Ciarkowski

customer_reviews.title: 3.5/5 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: It does do the job, but as soon as you touch it, you are very aware of how cheap it feels. As others have stated, I also find it a little annoying that I need to pull the headphones apart a bit to get it off the stand. Still going to give it 4/5 stars, but I really feel more like a 3.5 out of 5 stars. At least it's pretty cheap to buy so it's not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Classless

customer_reviews.title: Great headset holder
customer_reviews.text: Great looking headset holder! I got one for my friend, and liked it so much I ended up getting another one for myself. Looks really clean, and good for cord management.
customer_reviews.author: Caira Archer

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Practical!
customer_reviews.text: So cool! I know right where my headphones are and they are attractively displayed. I will be giving these for gifts this year as well. Seems I was always trying to remember where I had put them last. Imagine my thrill when, as watching one of my KDramas, I saw these on the desk! I love the design; it would work in any room. Sturdy and practical, but great looking, too!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son. Great product. He uses every day
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M.Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Functional, But Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This works as expected, but the quality is a bit lower than I imagined. It's also quite light, so it can be knocked over easily. I will probably upgrade to one with more weight at some point, but for now it keeps my headphones off my desk. It definitely doesn't look as good as the preview image, however. It's made of the same kind of plastic material as Samsung TV/Monitor bezels.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Finnigan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for myself and one for my son. They hold the headsets perfectly and look great too. Perfect solution to keep your headset from laying around on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Foote

customer_reviews.title: It's a headphone stand.
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand is okay. It's really light and somewhat flimsy so it can fall over easily. It's also a dust and fingerprint magnet so you will have to clean it often which becomes somewhat annoying. It's a headphone stand though and does as it should, there's really not much else to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient
customer_reviews.text: I was forever misplacing my wireless headphones and this little device is a lifesaver. It helps me remember to actually put the headphones back when I'm done with them, and then I know exactly where they are the next time I want to use them. Even better, it's clear, so it's not an eyesore. Nice streamlined shape just blends in and looks like it belongs without adding a cluttered look.
customer_reviews.author: jw408

customer_reviews.title: Great way to keep headphones from getting messed up, nice for display
customer_reviews.text: Great way to keep headphones from getting messed up, nice for display. Substantially made product.
customer_reviews.author: Iforgetmyname

customer_reviews.title: They really add to a set up
customer_reviews.text: If you have a rubber texture on your headphones or head set it may cause some problems how ever it works perfectly for my headset and it looks nice as well
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Works As Expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and sturdy headphone stand. It holds my B&O headphones perfectly, and allows me to pick it up and put it away with ease. It is very narrow and doesn't not take up much space. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: D.D

customer_reviews.title: Basic but Good
customer_reviews.text: Basic but good. It will hold any kind of covered earphones.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Substantial plastic, sturdy and holds my Bose over ear headphones without tipping. Very cool looking - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Snootybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient for headphone access
customer_reviews.text: Very stable means of reducing night stand clutter and easing access to headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works well for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like it, wish I had bought a hanger style headphone mount. That said, it is perfect for what it is. Made of reflective acrylic and holds myperfectly. You need to hold it down while you remove the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: kyle_el

product_meta.title: AmoVee Acrylic Headphone Stand Gaming Headset Holder/Hanger, Extra Thick - Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

Product Description
AmoVee display headphone stand is a perfect place for your headphones to call home.
If you are a physical headphone seller, it is a display for your headphone, simple and generous; or you are a headphone enthusiast, It is a place keep your headphone from damaging falls and extra wear and tear; This is an accessory to have space clean and tidy, it suits for everyone. 


What It Fit ?


Sennheiser：
URBANITE，MOMENTUM On-Ear Wireless， MOMENTUM On-Ear（M2）， HD 239， PC 310， PC 230， PC 31-II， PX 100-II， PX 200-II， PX 200-IIi， PXC 250-II， PX 95，MM 450-X TRAVEL 


 Sony:
100ABN, 100AAP, Z7, 1ABT, 1A, 1ADAC, 10RNC, ZX770BN, ZX770BT, ZX330BT, ZX310AP, ZX110NC, XB950BT, XB950AP 


Beats:
solo 2 wireless, solo 2 , studio wireless, studio, mixr, Pro – Fendi 


Bose:
QC25, SoundLink, SoundTrue, A20


Koss:
Pro4S, BT540i, SP540, UR23i, PRODJ100w, PRODJ200, QZ900, Porta Pro, Porta Pro KTC，SP330，ED1TC，R-10


Corsair:
VOID Wireless, VOID USB Dolby, H2100, H1500, HS40


Specifications:
-Material: High quality Acrylic
-Product Size: 9.8*4.7*2.4 inches (25 x 11.9 x 6.1cm)
-Package Size: 10.4*6.1*4.9 inches (26.5 x 15.5 x 12.5 cm)
-Thickness: 0.2 inch (0.5 cm)
-Weight: 23.1 oz (655g)
-Color: Black


Packing List:
-Acrylic headphone stand display
-Earphone NOT included.
feature_bullets: [ Very Important: ] This one is a updated version.We have made our headphone stand thicker and more stable. This is display stand for headphones fully and ergonomic design. Keep your desk clean at all times and always keep your headphones near and organized. Everything is in its place.

[ Just SO Neat ] AmoVee display headphone stand is just so neat with comfortable and sleek curve for you to touch by its special processed edge and pointedness. Compact design, no extra color and no extra decoration.An accessory to have space clean and tidy.

[ Perfect Size ] It's about 9.8 inches height, 0.24 inches thickness, 2.4 inches width and 4.7 inches between the bases. AmoVee display headphone stand will look great on your desk and holds the headphones properly keeping them up off the desk and not being thrown everywhere. Stands up perfectly with no toppling or wobbly feel to it at all.

[What It Fits for ] This universally-sized headphone stand will display headphones of all sizes, such as Sennheiser HD598 HD 650 HD700, Dre Beats Beats Solo, Koss PortaPro, Sony MDR7506, Philips, AKG K612, Bose QC15, Hyper X Cloud II's, Astro A50's, AT M50's, and TB 420x,etc.

[ Warranty ] At AmoVee, we believe in our display headphone stand. That's why every AmoVee display headphone stand includes an 12-month, worry-free guarantee. If you have any problem or suggestion, please kindly contact us freely, we surely will provide friendly, easy-to-reach support for you.
